page.title: 04THE WHEATSHEAF
page.content: My house is called "The Wheatsheaf". It is about 300 years old. My Grandad says it is the oldest house in the village. Many years ago the house was a pub, a blacksmiths, a slaughterhouse and butchers, and a bakery. Inside my house there are lots of wooden beams in all the ceilings. The wooden beams came from old ships like Nelson's flag ship. Underneath the pantry there used to be a cellar but it has been filled in now. Outside our back door there is an old water pump, It does not work now. At the side of the road, on a brick wall there is an old piece of wood which was used for shaping metal hoops which were put on wooden wheels on farm carts. I have lived here for eight years.
